Package fast3d.util

  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AVec
    a very simple call providing the basics to simulate accelerated movement
    ColorGen
    a color generator has some constant color values and functionality to create various color easily
    SimpleAudio
    a very simple wrapper around the core-audio-functionalities of java.sampled
    Sort
    in a 3d-environment some objects may cover others, so it is important to detect the order (far to near) in which to render objects
    the nested classes offer static methods to sort like described by the algorithms they are named like
    users should normally use Sort.
    Sort.Bubblesort
    Bubblesort is usually quite slow, but very fast if the array is pre-sorted
    Sort.Bubblesort.Renderables
    a static class giving methods to sort renderables using bubblesort
    Sort.Quicksort
    Quicksort is generally the best, because fastest, way of sorting an array, but is very slow if the array is pre-sorted
    Sort.Quicksort.Renderables
    a static class giving methods to sort renderables using quicksort
    Sort.Quicksort.Vectors
    a static class giving methods to sort vectors with quicksort
    TriangleStripGenerator
    a base class to generate a mesh out of its vertices
    you may extend this class inline just overriding the makeTriangle method
    the length of the triangle-strip can be quite infinite large (considering the amount of memory of the JVM)
    TriangleStripGenerator2d
    a base class to generate a surface-mesh out of its vertices
    you may extend this class inline just overriding the makeTriangle method and call add(Vector3d) for all vertices in the mesh and if the mesh is complete - you may call addToUniverse(Universe)
    one dimension of the 2d-surface is limited to the amount of calls of add(Vector3d) you determine in the constructor by setting the rowLength
    if that dimension is the width, than the height can be quite infinite large (considering the amount of memory of the JVM)
    to get triangles in the internal storage (given by getTriangles) you need to add at least (rowLength + 1) vertices
